prompt: Would anyone be willing to share what their process is for handling the inboxes of departed employees? e.g. set up an autoforward to their manager for a set period of time, give their log in to someone else for a set period of time, use Google takeout or similar to preserve the emails, archive/delete the account straight away
response:
# Common Approaches for Departed Employee Inboxes

Here are the most frequently used methods:

## **Auto-forward or Delegate Access** (Most Common)
- Forward to manager or team member for 30-90 days
- Use delegation/shared mailbox features rather than sharing passwords
- Gradually reduces forwarding period to wean senders off the old address

## **Auto-reply Setup**
- Configure out-of-office message directing people to new contact
- Include this even if forwarding is enabled
- Typically run for 30-60 days

## **Convert to Shared/Group Mailbox**
- Useful if the role will be refilled
- Multiple people can access without password sharing
- Maintains continuity for ongoing projects

## **Archive/Export Before Deletion**
- Use Google Takeout, PST export, or native archiving
- Store according to retention policies (legal/compliance requirements)
- Keep for 1-7 years depending on industry regulations

## **Timeline Example**
- **Day 1:** Disable login, set auto-reply, forward to manager
- **30 days:** Export/archive emails
- **60-90 days:** Stop forwarding, maintain archive only
- **Per policy:** Delete after retention period expires

## **Important Considerations**
- **Never share actual login credentials** - use proper delegation features
- Check legal/compliance requirements for your industry
- Document the process for consistency
- Consider whether litigation hold applies

What industry are you in? Retention requirements vary significantly.
